lpctools.configs.title: LPCTools configs - %s
lpctools.configs.generic.title: Generic
lpctools.configs.generic.configOpenGui.c: The key open the in-game config GUI
lpctools.configs.tools.title: Tools
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.name: showFillingAssistantConfig
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.comment:
Enable to list the configs for Filling Assistant
This tool helps you set blocks to fill holes automatically
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.hotkey.name: Hotkey
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.hotkey.comment: The key to open/close fillingAssistant tool
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.limitPlaceSpee: Limit the filling speed of the filling assistant to prevent being kicked out of some servers due to excessive packet sending
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.maxBlockPerTic: Set the maximum number of blocks the filling assistant can fill per tick on average
If ghost blocks or ghost items often appears, you can try to decrease this value
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.testDistance.c:
A higher value allows the Fill Assistant to search paths within a larger radius
This improves accuracy in detecting whether block placement will block the original path
but may significantly impact performance with larger values
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.disableOnLeftD: Disables Filling Assistant in game when left mouse button down
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.disableOnGUIOp: Disables Filling Assistant when GUI(such as config screen, ESC screen or inventory screen) opened
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.placeableItems: Items that can be placed as blocks by fillingAssistant
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.passableBlocks: Blocks that referred to as passage by fillingAssistant
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.transparentAsP: Let the filler assistant treat all transparent blocks as passable when pathfinding
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.notOpaqueAsPas:
Let the filler assistant treat all non-opaque blocks as passable when pathfinding
§8Don't ask me if this is a duplicate of the one above
§8If you ask, it's because Mojang did something weird
§8isTransparent() and !isOpaque() are not necessarily equal
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.requiredBlocks:
Blocks that reserved when filling blocks
No blocks will be placed next to such block by Filling Assistant.
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.offhandFilling: Uses offhand to operate when enabled
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.limitFillingRa: The maximum or minimum value limits the maximum or minimum coordinate of the block to be placed
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.outerRangeBloc: Refer to outer range blocks as unpassable, passable or origin
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.name: showLiquidCleanerConfig
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.comment:
Enable to list the configs for LiquidCleaner
This tool helps you set blocks to clean liquid automatically
Needs a lot of water-undestroyable water-unloggable non plant zero hardness blocks
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.hotkey.name: liquidCleanerHotkey
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.hotkey.comment: The key to open/close liquidCleaner tool
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.limitInteractS: Limit the interact speed of the liquid cleaner to prevent being kicked out of some servers due to excessive packet sending
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.maxBlockPerTic: Set the maximum number of blocks the liquid cleaner can fill or set (sum up) per tick on average
If ghost blocks or ghost items often appears, you can try to decrease this value
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.disableOnGUIOp: Disables Liquid Cleaner when GUI(such as config screen, ESC screen or inventory screen) opened
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.offhandFilling: Uses offhand to operate when enabled
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.blockBlackList:
Blocks excluded from being used by the fluid cleanup tool
For example, you can enter 'minecraft:slime_block'
This will restrict fluid cleanup to only use blocks like honey blocks or resin blocks
Prevents accidental damage to your TNT flying machines
lpctools.configs.utils.limitRange.name: limitCleaningRange
lpctools.configs.utils.limitRange.commen:
Limits cleaning range based on miniHUD shapes
(so that you should install miniHUD to enable this config)
lpctools.configs.utils.limitRange.rangeN:
Only regions with specific naming prefixes will be processed.
Default prefix: "LC", then valid formats include:
"+LC","-LC","+~LC","-~LC"
Symbol semantics explained in "Region Operation Mode" below.
lpctools.configs.utils.limitRange.rangeL:
Treat Litematica's render range as a special region for calculation.
Processing priority: After all Litematica schematics, but before other MiniHUD regions.
lpctools.configs.utils.limitRange.render:
Four operation modes for schematic render ranges:
"+": Add shape to allowed area (Union)
"-": Subtract shape from allowed area (Difference)
"+": Add area outside shape (Inverse Union)
"-": Keep only overlapping area (Intersection)
